Photo by Leticia Roncero
Making San Francisco Safer

The Mayor’s Office of Violence Prevention Services, founded in 2012, works to make San Francisco safer by leading initiatives that involve multiple departments of city government, community-based organizations, and the private sector.

Street Violence Intervention Program

SVIP workers build relationships with a neighborhood, and work with the community there to prevent street violence.

Outreach
Coordination

By coordinating city departments and local organizations, we make sure that people impacted by street violence get the support they need.

Coordination
IPO Employment Program

The IPO Employment Program connects young people in areas with high levels of street violence with opportunities that put them on a path to success.

Employment
The Mayor put this together, but it’s not just a whole bunch of guys in ties...we got ground level people here really trying to make a difference.
Brian Legaspi
Case Manager, Arriba Juntos

Photo by Joshua Vining

Interrupt, Predict, Organize Initiative

Mayor Edwin Lee launched the Interrupt, Predict and Organize (IPO) initiative in 2012 to promote public safety in San Francisco. Our office works to realize the vision set by the IPO initiative.

Read about the Initiative

About this website

The Mayor's Office of Violence Prevention Services website is a resource to learn about what the city government is doing to make San Francisco safer. Exploring this site you can learn about our innovative initiatives and collaborations, read success stories, and examine data on outcomes.

Office of The Mayor
